void PostProcessing::Debug::beginChain ( uint32  nEffects  )  [virtual]

This method should be called to let the debug object know an entire chain is about to be drawn.

It resets some internal variables.

Parameters:
nEffects number of effects in the chain.

void PostProcessing::Debug::beginEffect ( uint32  nPhases  )  [virtual]

This method should be called to let the debug object know an effect is about to draw.

It resets some internal variables.

Parameters:
nPhases number of phases in the effect.

static bool PostProcessing::Debug::Check ( PyObject *  pObject  )  [inline, static]

Reimplemented from PyObjectPlus.

void PostProcessing::Debug::copyPhaseOutput ( Moo::RenderTargetPtr  pRT  ) 

This method takes a snapshot of the supplied render target and copies it in our internally held render target, in some spot calculated by the effect/phase id we are currently in.

Parameters:
pRT Render target containing the results of the latest phase.

void PostProcessing::Debug::drawDisabledPhase (  ) 

This method draws a grey box where a phase would be recorded.

It indicates the phase has been temporarily disabled.

void PostProcessing::Debug::enabled ( bool  e  )  [inline]

bool PostProcessing::Debug::enabled (  )  const [inline]

PyObject* PostProcessing::Debug::get_py_phaseUV (  )  [inline]

RECT PostProcessing::Debug::nextPhase (  )  [virtual]

This method advances to the next phase in the output chain.

It returns the viewport rectangle that a phase containing its own method for previewing should draw into.

Internally it increments the phase index, meaning for a phase you should call nextPhase once and once onlye.

Vector4 PostProcessing::Debug::phaseUV ( uint32  effect,
uint32  phase,
uint32  nEffects,
uint32  nPhases 
) [virtual]

This method returns the texture coordinates for the given effect/phase pair, packed into a Vector4 as ( bl.x, bl.y, tr.x, tr.y ), or ( l, b, r, t ).

Parameters:
effect index of the effect within the PostProcessing chain
phase index of the phase within the effect
nEffects number of effects
nPhases number of phases within the desired effect
Returns:
Vector4 packed uv coordinates of the phase
